text: I love how they tried to tie in the old twister movie to the new one.
Some pretty crazy footage here
Providing a glimpse into a horrific blunder of mother nature and it's destruction, Netflix chose to follow the stories of individuals who attempt to paint a picture of their view of that tragic day.

Jaw dropping, literally. 

This is more than the documentation of a massive tornado.  It brings all the elements of small town simplicity, a religious prophecy met with shocking accuracy, and young people filled with hope of the future/juxtapose a tragedy on par with the actual prediction of their town’s Armageddon. I love that the film focuses on the youth’s experience of it, as it portraits all the hope and innocence of that time in life, and how profoundly it shapes them, after enduring it.  

Also I thought the actual real time footage and the created content, seemed to blend seamlessly, and the backdrop music added the perfect element of awesome, and eerie.  

Truly surprised by this one. Don’t overthink it. Just enjoy, and be glad it’s not you.
Pretty intense, a bit narrow focus on a handful of individuals, with some crazy video and audio. But the completely offhand global warning comment at the end leaves a bad taste.

The visual effects led my right brain to enjoy the cinema. Like the original Twister, the storms and their effects were excellently portrayed. But the perforated plot and overall storyline left me unsatiated. Tragedy during the first act was predictable, based on the original Twiser. But the obligatory romance between the lead characters was both too rapidly initiated and ultimately unfulfilled in the final act. Bologna was sandwiched between the two and seasoned with schmalz and hollow altruism. For those reasons, I nominate the storm as the best actor in the film.

Not what I expected. Went too deep into the lives of these individuals, way more detail than needed. I hoped to see more footage of the tornado, more on the aftermath of the destruction, some aerial footage before and after, maybe a couple survivor stories. It was difficult to tell what was actual footage and what wasn't. I was disappointed.

This movie is pretty bad. Ludicrous scenarios, flat acting with no charisma and god awful music. It's only saving grace issue is the CGI representation of the storms which is actually pretty impressive. Everything else was mediocre!
A very well documentary from the Deadly Joplin Tornado. A really well put film together and very emotional as well!
Immersive, thrilling and frightening, this documentary very well shows the vulnerability of all us humans when confronted with the mighty force of nature.
I found it very well paced and easy to watch, not a fan of this kind of docu but I liked it

Alexandra Lacey did a bad thing.  She took a human piece and hung the whole 1-1/2 hour experience on an uncited statement before credits ran.  If this is the result of climate change, make a documentary that has information to support that viewpoint.  Intellectually lazy.  And dishonest seeing as though it’s not part of the advertisement, I was part of a captured audience at that point.
This is a good documentary on a bad twister, but saying it was caused by global warming at the end to push a agenda really made me lose respect for the film.
I was compelled mid-viewing to write a review. How this doesn't have higher ratings is beyond me. These stories are so intense.  I lost track of how many times my jaw dropped.  Fantastic show!

I remember watching the series about Storm chasers a few years back and the storm that went through Joplin. So when I saw this was on Netflix I was anxious to see it. Seeing those first hand accounts and the devastating after effects really leaves an impression. It was tough to see some of the footage due to my own fear of tornadoes. The only thing I can say critically is I wish there were more eyewitness accounts thrown in. Regardless it was a fantastic documentary and my heart goes out to everyone in Joplin and all of those to assisted in the recovery and clean up. 🙏
This is a potential award winning documentary. Well directed and in the top 10 best documentaries I have ever seen on NETFLIX. It was heart pounding, emotional and engaging. I highly recommend.

This disaster documentary was really good. The entire crew did a fantastic job on telling this story and how intense and deadly it was for everyone who experienced it. If you haven't seen this documentary yet, check it out sometime. It's a definite must see.

Excellent! Well done documentary (timeline wise) at taking the viewer through the beginning of the day (with clear, sunny skies) and progressing to what would become the most deadly/devastating tornado in the 21st. century.
Not what I was looking for. Guess I need to watch storm chasers to watch the actual tornados.

The Twister: Caught In The Storm - 10/10. Netflix docs are really hit and miss these days, but this is a reminder that Netflix was (and still is in a sense) a good source for incredible content. The Twister is a perfect example of a documentary that shows the impact of a natural disaster on regular folk. Its easy for us to glance over the impact or magnitude of something due to the popularity of a movie or series that involves natural disasters. Heck, I’m a huge fan of the Twister films and natural disaster movies in general, and this doc reminded me that the entertainment we get from those visuals are nightmares for others. This is based around a category 5 twister that hit in 2011, and the impact it had on the graduating class of Joplin. Through interviews, retrospective news, and live footage from the scenes, this doc shows you that the “end of days” situation that these people went through is no joke whatsoever. The doc does an amazing job of showing how scary and how frightening it might have been if you were there at the time. Its scary to see how big and how damaging this twister is. You see all these people who look back at the event and tell it with grief and pain. And when you see the storm chasing footage, it really gives a shiver down your spine as to how huge the twister is. This felt really impactful from the start to finish, and it makes you remember that nature is nothing to be messed with.
